title: BBC Local Live: Merseyside on Wednesday 13 January 2016 - BBC News
summary: new emergency response after jasmine lapsley 's death .
merseyside chief constable sir jon murphy set to retire .
scheme to safeguard cheshire domestic abuse victims launched .
nine people charged in upton anti-fracking operation .
st. helens mp leads debate over roll out of universal credit .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates from merseyside and cheshire have finished for the day but we 'll be back at 08:00 on thursday with the latest news , sport , weather and travel .

documents.title: coming up on north west tonight
text: on north west tonight this evening :
- nine people have been charged after anti-fracking protesters were evicted from a camp near chester yesterday
- sir jon murphy , the chief constable of merseyside , is to retire in june .
author: Roger Johnson
Presenter, BBC North West Tonight

documents.title: weather : wet , with snow over hills , windy later
text: occasionally heavy rain and hill snow will slowly push east through the night .
where skies clear a locally sharp frost could develop , particularly in rural areas of the wirral with coastal gales possible by morning .
tomorrow will see rain and sleet or hill snow , along with strong winds , gradually pushing east through the day .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: creed : liverpool boxer tony bellew 'astonished ' by role
text: world boxing champion tony bellew has told the bbc he can not believe he acted `` alongside hollywood superstars '' in the forthcoming rocky sequel .
creed , the seventh film in the rocky series , was partly filmed in liverpool and also features everton football club , with the final bout taking place at goodison park .

documents.title: chester zoo announces record visitor numbers
text: chester zoo had 1.6m visitors in 2015 , making it the busiest year in their 85-year history .

documents.title: former everton striker marcus bent pleads guilty to affray
text: ex-premier league footballer marcus bent has admitted a charge of affray after an incident at his home in surrey last september .
the 37-year-old former everton striker has already pleaded guilty to possessing cocaine at guildford crown court .
he faced charges after an incident in which he was reportedly tasered by police responding to reports of a break-in at his home .

documents.title: upton anti-fracking camp : nine charged after eviction
text: nine people have been charged with a number of offences , including aggravated trespass and obstructing a police officer , following an operation to remove anti-fracking protesters from a test drilling site .
campaigners were evicted yesterday from a camp at upton , near chester , where they had been since april 2014 .
author: Phil McCann
Political reporter, Cheshire

documents.title: former soldier and amputee to climb mount kilimanjaro
text: chester resident peter bowker , a former lance corporal in the dragoon guards , is to climb mount kilimanjaro with fellow injured servicemen to raise awareness of post traumatic stress disorder .
author: Chester Chronicle

documents.title: paint ball guns stolen in whiston robbery
text: merseyside police is appealing for information following a burglary at whiston family centre on old colliery road in whiston .
six paint ball guns were stolen when the centre was burgled sometime between 17:30 and 19:30 on monday , police said .

documents.title: rugby union : jones quits exeter for league return
text: former st helens utility player josh jones has left premiership side exeter chiefs to return to rugby league .

the 22-year-old made the switch to union in june , but has not made a first-team appearance for the chiefs and will now head back north with his partner , who is expecting their first child in the summer .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: latest headlines in cheshire and merseyside
text: today 's top stories in headlines in cheshire and merseyside :

documents.title: pensioner incensed after being charged 50p for a glass of tap water in runcorn pub
text: everton fan tom whitfield , 69 , went into the castle hotel in halton village to watch his team play manchester city and was outraged after being charged for a glass of tap water .
author: Runcorn and Widnes World

documents.title: rugby league : widnes sign connor farrell
text: widnes have added to their 2016 squad with signing of connor farrell from wigan on loan for the season .
the 22-year-old made his super league debut in 2014 and featured eight times for wigan in 2015 .
author: Mike Hughes
Reporter, BBC Radio Merseyside Sport

documents.title: travel : delays from lime street to north east
text: there are delays between liverpool lime street and the north east due to a. safety inspection of the track in yorkshire .
more from bbc travel
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: new emergency response after jasmine lapsley 's death
text: changes which would help improve 999 response times for summer emergencies have been made after a liverpool girl choked to death on a grape , the welsh ambulance service says .
six-year-old jasmine lapsley from liverpool collapsed and died while on holiday in morfa nefyn , gwynedd in 2014 .

documents.title: scheme to safeguard cheshire domestic abuse victims launched
text: schools and colleges across cheshire are linking with police and social services to safeguard victims of domestic abuse .
operation encompass will see extra measures to help youngsters when the authorities notify them of problems within their families .

documents.title: latest headlines in cheshire and merseyside
text: today 's top stories in cheshire and merseyside :

documents.title: lfc apply to trademark `` the normal one ''
text: liverpool football club have made an official application to have `` the normal one '' trademarked under european law .
manager jurgen klopp coined the phrase to describe himself in his first press conference at anfield after he took over from brendan rogers in october last year .
he told reporters `` i am a totally normal guy .
i am the normal one , maybe '' .

documents.title: giant crane used to lift dock beams in mersey gateway construction
text: our 550 tonne crane at bridgewater which is being used to lift the 106 tonne deck beams # thisiscivilengineering

documents.title: motorcyclist injured after hit and run
text: a 27-year-old man was injured this morning after his motorbike was involved in a collision with a car in norris green .

merseyside police are appealing for witnesses after the rider was knocked off his blue peugeot bike by a light-coloured jaguar estate near the junction of dwerryhouse lane and carr lane east at around 07:00 gmt .
police say two men are reported to have got out of the car , which had roof bars and alloy wheels , before returning to it and driving away .
they said the motorcyclist is in a `` serious but stable '' condition in hospital where he is being treated for internal injuries .

documents.title: watch : henri matisse 's the snail in liverpool
text: bay tv takes a look at an exhibition revealing more about henri matisse 's famous abstract painting the snail .
watch digital nation : matisse at the tate

documents.title: warrington ptsd centre helps veterans across the world
text: a centre in warrington that helps veterans with post-traumatic stress disorder ( ptsd ) is now helping hundreds of people from across the world .
blue apple veterans was set up by mark smith in 2012 after he recovered from ptsd that was so severe he was having seven flashbacks a day .
he joined the army when he was 16 and served for 10 years as a paratrooper in war zones including kosovo and northern ireland .

documents.title: brothers ' £ 2million fortune earned legitimately , say lawyers
text: a £ 2million fortune accumulated by two gangster brothers was earned through legitimate businesses , their lawyers have argued .
author: Southport Visiter

documents.title: merseyside 's chief constable set to retire
text: chief constable of merseyside police , sir jon murphy has announced he will retire .
he has been in the post since 2010 and began his career as a police cadet with the merseyside force in 1975 .
during a career spanning four decades , he has been commended on 14 occasions , received the queen 's police medal in 2007 and was knighted in 2014 .

in a statement , sir jon said : `` it is with a heavy heart that i have made the decision to retire and i have enjoyed my 41 years in the service , but it is now time to move on and let someone else take the force forward . ''

documents.title: st helens man jailed for torture of elderly man
text: a st helens man was jailed for a two-hour systematic torture '' of an elderly man partly filmed on a mobile phone .
author: Liverpool Echo

documents.title: travel : accident in croxteth , liverpool
text: lower house lane in liverpool is closed and there is slow traffic in both directions between the storrington avenue junction and the carr lane junction because of an accident .
more from bbc travel
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: merseyside boy swine flu vaccine claim refused
text: the government is refusing to consider a claim for damages after a merseyside boy developed a compulsive sleeping disorder following a swine-flu vaccination .
lucas carlton from liverpool was given the vaccine during the pandemic in 2011 , when a close family friend became seriously ill with swine-flu .
stephen twigg , the labour mp for liverpool west derby , called the special commons debate .

documents.title: latest headlines in cheshire and merseyside
text: today 's top stories in cheshire and merseyside :

documents.title: st helens and knowsley fire teams could merge
text: a fire service manager has spoken about the possibility of a future merger of firefighting teams in st helens and knowsley .
author: St Helens Star

documents.title: weather : some wintry showers expected later
text: stays dry & bright for many but showers move in from the west .
some will be wintry , even at low levels later si

documents.title: merseyside mp leads debate on universal credit
text: merseyside mp marie rimmer is leading a debate in westminster today over the roll out of universal credit .
six working-age benefits - including income support and housing benefit - are now merged into one payment that is being rolled out to all claimants .
the department for work and pensions says will simplify welfare , make it less vulnerable to mistakes and is already transforming lives .

documents.title: latest headlines in cheshire and merseyside
text: today 's top stories in cheshire and merseyside :

documents.title: travel : accident on m53 in cheshire
text: there is queuing traffic and one lane is closed on the m53 southbound between junction 6 at hooton and junction 7 at overpool because of an accident .
congestion is to junction 4 , bebington .
more from bbc travel
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: weather : a bright start but heavy showers later
text: after a cold but bright start , expect the rain to return .
there will be heavy showers with a risk of thunder at times .
highs of 6c .
more from bbc weather
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live news coverage
text: hello from liverpool , i 'm here with all your news , sport , travel and weather updates from across merseyside today .
if you 've got a story you 'd like me to hear about or a photograph you 'd like to share , you can contact me on email , facebook or twitter .
author: Jenny Coleman
Reporter, BBC Local Live
